newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.

text.p: In the South, rice prices were steady to 0.50 cents lower. Long grain milled rice prices were selling mostly at $19.50 to $20.00 per cwt. Medium grain traded mostly at $18.50 to $19.00. Second heads were steady at 14.00-14.50 and brewers remain in very tight supply. Rice by-products were near steady with bran prices steady to $2.00 higher; millfeed was steady to $3.00 higher.
In California, rice prices were steady with Medium grain selling mostly at $20.00. Rice bran was steady to $5.00 lower.
California rice ship loadings: At the Port of Sacramento for the week ending November 2, 1996 the Yong Jiang loaded 13,750 mt of bulk U.S. medium grain milled rice destined for Turkey.

Inspections of California rice for export: There were 303,270 cwt of U.S. medium grain milled rice inspected for the week ending November 2, 1996. The yearly total since October 1, 1996 is 303,270 cwt compared to 853,458 cwt a year ago.

The following prices were for domestic shipment -- offers, FOB mills, milled rice, dollars per cwt, bagged. (All milled rice grade 2 not to exceed 4 percent brokens, except California grade 1. All second heads grade 4 or better)
Feed by-products prices (dollars per short ton, fob mills).
